intro: Dorstenia poinsettiifolia var. etugeana, commonly known as the Etugean False Shamrock, is a unique member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white and green patterns. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental foliage, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in warm climates.
